intro: Anthenantia columbiensis, commonly known as the Columbia sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its blooming period occurs in the spring and early summer, producing vibrant violet or purple flowers. Anthenantia columbiensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
